item.title: Hollywood director James Cameron opens up on AI, future Terminator films and the Avatar franchise
item.description: The Hollywood director has been present in the film space for many years but the emergence of AI and its power has him somewhat scared for the future.

item.title: Naracoorte after-school care closure hits parents struggling with childcare crisis
item.description: Parents rely on after-school care to be able to participate in the workforce, but in one SA country town, the only provider's future is unclear.

item.title: Jane Goodall changed how we thought about chimps. Why did we know so little before?
item.description: In the chimp world, there was the time before Jane Goodall and the time after. This is the reason we knew so little about the great ape before 1960, according to the woman who dedicated her life to humankind's closest cousins.

item.title: Bendigo nurses call for hospital mental health hub as ED presentations climb
item.description: An increase in mental health and drug-related emergencies puts strain on Bendigo hospital's emergency department, prompting calls for a dedicated treatment hub.

item.title: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon says he wants to get force's culture 'right'
item.description: The new commissioner of NSW Police does not believe there is still a "boys' club" within the force, but says behaviour that prompted a workplace culture review will not be accepted under his leadership.

item.title: Hawthorn beats Fremantle by 15 points as gritty performance proves AFLW top-four credentials
item.description: Hawthorn posts a third consecutive AFLW victory to boost its top-four hopes, outlasting Fremantle in cold and windy conditions in Frankston.

item.title: Mind games and magic as Maguire and Bellamy battle it out for NRL supremacy
item.description: Craig Bellamy and Michael Maguire know each other better than most NRL coaches, and that familiarity will play a major part in how they tackle the NRL grand final.

item.title: Outback residents lose solar farm as Ergon battles push owner to close
item.description: The owner of a huge solar farm in outback Queensland hits the kill switch after almost a decade, saying his contract with Ergon Energy was unfair.

item.title: Housing crisis, massive cows and canola fields visible from space feature in our top September news photos
item.description: From gargantuan cows to Canola fields visible from space, here are our top photos from WA's first month of spring.

item.title: WA gold projects forecast to create more jobs than iron ore in next five years
item.description: The gold-mining sector is set to boost WA's economy, with 2,400 new jobs forecast over the next five years compared to 1,200 in iron ore.

item.title: Vladimir Putin swipes back at Donald Trump's 'paper tiger' comment, sends warning to NATO
item.description: The Russian president says it is NATO that is the "paper tiger," and "if anyone still has a desire to compete with us in the military sphere, as we say, feel free, let them try".

item.title: ASX rises as DigiCo surges as Telstra fined $18m over misleading customers — as it happened
item.description: The ASX has made modest gains after trading flat early on, as a slide for energy producers offset gains for industrial, healthcare and tech stocks.

item.title: Zach Merrett's Essendon future in Bombers' hands despite star's apparent best and fairest farewell
item.description: Zach Merrett's speech after winning Essendon's best and fairest seems like a farewell, but it will be up to the Bombers as to whether the captain is allowed to leave the club in the AFL trade period.

item.title: Family of man killed in level crossing crash says safety trial a 'waste of time'
item.description: Ethan Hunter's mother says governments have failed to learn from her son's death at a level crossing in regional New South Wales.

item.title: Firefighters tackle Brisbane bushfire, dozens of other incidents after hot weather
item.description: Queensland firefighters tackling scores of incidents, including a bushfire about 20 kilometres north of Brisbane now downgraded after police made an emergency declaration.

item.title: Revised corridor for New England REZ leaves Walcha residents 'shocked'
item.description: Property owners in the path of a proposed new route for the New England renewable energy zone corridor fear their land values will plummet.

item.title: Usman Khawaja prepares for Australia's monumental Ashes summer, unafraid of 'the end'
item.description: Usman Khawaja is riding his late-career resurgence into another Ashes summer, and says his comfort with an inevitable end has inspired it all.

item.title: Darwin businesses call for return of late-night security patrols amid violence, anti-social behaviour
item.description: There's been a spike in reports of violent and anti-social incidents in the CBD, as Darwin businesses call for more government investment in late-night security patrols.

item.title: Hopes new Australian fabric will revitalise domestic clothing manufacturing
item.description: Scientists, farmers and the fashion industry collaborate to create a natural fabric that is both woven and knitted, low on emissions and set to shake up how we think about clothing.

item.description: The City of Yarra mayor has lashed the government over the mapping, saying residents will bear the costs of inadequate infrastructure investment.

item.title: Man threatened woman with gun before rape, kidnap, police allege

item.title: Disability employment provider Bedford kept afloat with $4.4m funding injection as hunt for buyer continues
item.description: Australia's second-largest disability employment provider Bedford will be kept afloat by a $4.4 million federal government funding injection as it seeks a buyer for the embattled business.

item.description: An algal bloom causing toxic foam and fish kills along South Australia's beaches prompts holiday-makers to consider alternative summer travel plans.

item.description: Tasmanian potato farmers have rejected a second pay offer from multinational processor Simplot that would see farmers paid less per kilo than last year.

item.description: Rohen James Hanson will spend at least the next 17 years behind bars for murdering his partner in a remote cabin on the NSW Mid North Coast in 2021.

item.title: Line dancing helps Queensland community connect and keep moving
item.description: Organisers behind line dancing events say more people are coming to their evenings, and social media is driving its popularity.

item.title: Health workers say NT leading the nation in hepatitis B care, as diagnoses jump but mortality rates plummet
item.description: Health workers say new data showing hepatitis B cases have almost tripled in the NT reflects better access to care, with the territory also leading the nation in reducing mortality rates.

item.title: Babe's 30th anniversary celebrated in Robertson where film was shot
item.description: Decades after hosting film crews making a children's movie about a loveable piglet, the town of Robertson in New South Wales is transformed into a country fair in tribute.

item.title: UK police hold four people on suspicion of terror offences over Manchester synagogue attack
item.description: UK police are continuing to question four people arrested on suspicion of terror offences after an attack on a Manchester synagogue on Thursday that left two people dead.

item.title: Greens leader says she is unsure about Robbins Island wind farm
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Greens leader Larissa Waters 'doesn't know very much' about wind farm opposed by colleagues
item.description: Larissa Waters says she will be looking closely at the Robbins Island wind farm, which the Greens's two Tasmanian senators say will threaten several endangered species.

item.title: Community saves endangered tropical sea turtle that washed up on Esperance beach
item.description: A community has sprung into action to nurse a juvenile tropical turtle back to health as wildlife carers question how it found its way to WA's south coast.

item.title: Harry Lush director of Gondwana Project
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: English springer spaniels Kelly and Milo helping fight dieback in Western Australia
item.description: Two dogs join the fight against one of the biggest threats to Australia's native plants, making dieback detection possible in minutes rather than weeks.

item.title: I got an unexpected afternoon tea invitation, and it told me a lot about Donald Trump
item.description: An afternoon tea meeting with a president is not the sort of invitation you get every day as a foreign correspondent, but when I met Finland's Alexander Stubb in Helsinki, it taught me a lot about another world leader.

item.title: Inside the 'Trinity of Chaos' group of young hackers targeting major companies
item.description: Cybersecurity analysts warn that three of the most notorious English-speaking cybercrime groups are still operating as the "super group" known as Trinity of Chaos, despite recently announcing retirement.

item.title: Woman charged with murder of man believed to be her partner, police say
item.description: A woman has been charged with murder after a man was reported unconscious in South Australia's mid-north on Friday and could not be revived.

item.title: Homicide Squad investigating 'suspicious' death of 84yo woman in Sydney suburb of Melonba
item.description: The Homicide Squad is investigating the circumstances surrounding the death of an 84-year-old woman, who was found in her bedroom about midday Saturday.

item.title: Trump authorises deployment of 300 National Guard troops to Chicago
item.description: US President Donald Trump has deployed 300 Illinois National Guard troops to Chicago after Governor JB Pritzker refused to do so.

item.title: Who is Sanae Takaichi, set to be Japan's first female PM?
item.description: Sanae Takaichi has won Japan's Liberal Democratic Party's leadership contest and is likely to become the country's first female PM. Here's what we know about her.

item.title: US Treasury unveils draft design for $1 Trump coin to mark 250th independence celebrations
item.description: In 2020, the US Congress passed a law that allows the Treasury Secretary to mint $1 coins in 2026 "with designs emblematic of the US semi-quincentennial".

item.title: Lithuania's Vilnius Airport reopens after unknown balloon sightings halt flights over the weekend
item.description: In total, around 30 flights and nearly 6,000 passengers were impacted by the closures.

item.title: Mark Latham's ex-girlfriend Nathalie Matthews charged with sharing intimate images
item.description: Nathalie Matthews, 38, was arrested after arriving into Sydney on a flight from Dubai this morning.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos beat Melbourne Storm in epic NRL grand final, Adam Reynolds injured, Brisbane ends Roosters' NRLW streak in decider
item.description: The Brisbane Broncos beat the Melbourne Storm 26-22 in the NRL grand final despite losing both halves to injury in the second half.

item.title: More than 100 guns seized in WA Police raids targeting 'sovereign citizens'
item.description: More than 100 firearms are seized in a WA Police operation targeting 'sovereign citizens' in the wake of the fatal shooting of two Victorian officers.

item.title: The advice Ray Martin lives by and the line journalists 'shouldn't cross'
item.description: After six decades as a journalist, Ray Martin says he has learnt the secret to a long and satisfying career.

item.title: Mega-team of heavy horses sets world record at Good Old Days Festival
item.description: Scores of heavy horses have been harnessed together at a heritage festival in southern New South Wales in what organisers say is a world record.

item.title: European Space Agency launches second space antenna in New Norcia, north of Perth
item.description: A second deep space antenna opened in a tiny monastic town in Western Australia could help unlock the secrets of the universe.

item.title: Rescuers recover more bodies of teenage victims after school collapse in Indonesia
item.description: The number of students confirmed dead after the collapse of an Islamic boarding school building in Indonesia has risen to 45, the country's search and rescue agency says.

item.title: Mass civil wedding in Paraguay's capital sees more than 600 couples say 'I do' in unison
item.description: The event was part of a government campaign aiming to make civil weddings more accessible across the country.

item.title: Tigers end AFLW drought in shock 11-point win over Crows as Blues and Eagles enjoy victories
item.description: Richmond's dismal losing streak is over, with midfielder Monique Conti playing a starring role in a shock win over competition heavyweights Adelaide.

item.title: Authorities will investigate campfire that sparked major Moreton Island blaze
item.description: A "careless" campfire lit during a fire ban sparked a rapidly moving blaze that has now burnt hundreds of hectares on Moreton Island, according to authorities.

item.title: Liberty Bell Bay smelter receives first shipment of ore since flagging financial woes
item.description: A $20 million loan from the Tasmanian government to keep smelter Liberty Bell Bay afloat after it flagged financial woes earlier this year has led to the first shipment of ore being delivered.

item.title: Zion Williamson stars as NBA side New Orleans Pelicans defeat Phoenix 127-92
item.description: The New Orleans Pelicans have outclassed the South East Melbourne Phoenix 127-92 to conclude their two-game Australian tour.

item.title: Mele Haufanga's NRLW premiership-winning try now an unsolvable mystery
item.description: Brisbane and the Roosters played one of the greatest games in NRLW history, but the controversial winning try to Mele Haufanga shapes as a football mystery that might never be solved.

item.title: Dozens dead after landslides, flash floods in Nepal and India's Darjeeling region
item.description: Heavy rain triggers landslides and flash floods, blocking roads, washing away bridges and killing dozens in Nepal and West Bengal, according to authorities.

item.title: F1 Singapore Grand Prix: Lando Norris hits Oscar Piastri on first lap, George Russell wins
item.description: Oscar Piastri has been left furious at his teammate, and his team, after his two drivers' championship rivals gained ground on him in the Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix.

item.title: Man in critical condition after shooting in Sydney's Croydon Park as police arrest alleged gunman
item.description: NSW Police say the alleged gunman had been "firing indiscriminately at passing vehicles including police vehicles".

item.title: Reece Walsh wins Clive Churchill Medal to ice Broncos' NRL premiership success
item.description: In one of the greatest individual performances in grand final history, Brisbane Broncos star Reece Walsh was judged player of the match after inspiring his side to their victory over the Melbourne Storm.

item.title: NRL grand final quick hits: Reece Walsh rushes to catch a concussed Ben Hunt and Broncos overcome injury toll
item.description: Reece Walsh put in an NRL grand final performance for the ages after an early stroke of luck as the Brisbane Broncos survived the loss of both Ben Hunt and Adam Reynolds to end a 19-year premiership drought.

item.title: How the internet reacted to Brisbane Broncos winning the NRL grand final
item.description: The internet could barely believe what was happening as Brisbane, fuelled by Reece Walsh's brilliance, came from behind to win the NRL grand final.

item.title: Why Brisbane Broncos's NRL premiership win is more about blood than gold
item.description: The Brisbane Broncos are flash and have never made apologies for it but, with their premiership win, they've proven they also have the true steel of champions.

item.title: Australia's de facto online betting regulator accused of being too close to gambling industry
item.description: Four Corners has uncovered allegations of conflicts of interest and pro-industry bias at the country's part-time regulator responsible for Australia's biggest betting companies.

item.title: Spring heatwave creates dangerous fire conditions across Queensland
item.description: Temperatures could soar to almost 10 degrees above average this week, increasing the risk of bushfires that are already burning across the state.

item.title: Inside the mission to rescue dachshund Valerie from wild 529-day Kangaroo Island ordeal
item.description: Valerie's disappearance on South Australia's Kangaroo Island unleashed a 529-day hunt. She dodged rescue attempts and traps and had some wondering whether the sausage dog was mocking them and having the time of her life.

item.title: Documents reveal Australia's F-35 jet fighter export details 'quietly' disappeared
item.description: Department of Defence emails show that a website dedicated to Australia's role in the global F-35 supply chain used by Israel to maintain its jet fighters was removed at the start of the war in Gaza.

item.title: Housing supply without controlling demand suggests National Housing Accord won't fix affordability
item.description: The national project to fix housing affordability is off to a slow start but, from deposit schemes and negative gearing to immigration and construction delays, the reasons are complex.

item.title: Russia launches drone and missile strikes on Ukraine
item.description: Authorities say nine regions across Ukraine were targeted by Russian night-time drone, missile and aerial bomb strikes.

item.title: The fate of Hobart's proposed AFL Macquarie Point stadium rests with a handful of politicians
item.description: The future of Tasmania's proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium rests in the hands of the state's politicians. So who will vote which way, and what is the chance it will actually get up?

item.title: Melbourne Storm's new normal falls short in NRL grand finals and they're running out of chances
item.description: The new and infinitely more exciting Melbourne Storm are finding out just how hard it is to play their exciting brand of footy when the tension is at its peak.

item.title: SA seafood demand still down as algal bloom safety message struggles to break through
item.description: While industry and government tell consumers South Australian seafood is safe, consumer demand is still down amid the algal bloom, with businesses concerned they may not survive.

item.title: New playground equipment encourages children to learn through 'risky play'
item.description: 'Cliff riders' have sparked concern among some community members, but 20 have been installed across the country in an effort to help children learn through risk-taking.

item.title: SA foster care providers working to bring more culturally and linguistically diverse carers into the system
item.description: Masooma came to Adelaide as a refugee from Afghanistan in 2016, and has become the carer of a young girl from a similar cultural background. Experts say it is important carers reflected the diversity of children in care.

item.title: Sydney youth workers fighting to keep kids away from a life of crime

item.title: The man most Palestinians want as their leader has spent years in solitary confinement
item.description: Despite spending more than 20 years behind bars, Marwan Barghouti is the man most Palestinians would want as their leader.

item.title: Decades-old 'conversion therapy' resurfaces in today's trans youth healthcare debate
item.description: A decades-old psychiatric study is influencing current debates over transgender youth health care. But a new analysis led by a survivor says the findings were deeply harmful and dangerously misleading.

item.title: Live updates: Wall Street edges higher as US government shutdown continues, ASX eyes new record
item.description: The S&P 500 has eked out a marginal gain to a new record, giving the ASX a positive lead for today. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Older Territorians say they still feel unsafe as residents' homes targeted by armed thugs
item.description: There are growing calls for the NT government to ban machetes and crossbows as older residents share horror stories of being targeted in their own homes by armed youths.

item.title: East Gippsland volunteer groups left to pick up insurance bill on Crown land
item.description: A council in Victoria's east tells volunteer groups it will no longer pay for their insurance policies, sparking community concerns and raising questions as to whose responsibility it should be.

item.title: Ten years on from 2015, Ben Hunt wins the Broncos premiership he's waited for his whole life
item.description: Defeat in the 2015 decider was so scarring, Hunt eventually felt the need to move away from the club he loves. Ten years later and back in his home colours, he's a 350-game, premiership-winning NRL player.

item.title: Federal politics live: Communications minister summons telco bosses to meeting
item.description: Communications Minister Anika Wells has sent the chiefs of Australia's three largest telcos a letter, summoning them to a meeting in Canberra. Follow live.

item.title: Outback businesses raise concerns about Services Australia's Centrepay reforms
item.description: Business owners worry major changes to a buy now, pay later system used by about 500,000 social security recipients will cause a raft of issues when it begins next month.

item.title: Griffin Coal failure sees WA taxpayers fork out millions to Indian bank, despite government promises
item.description: The WA government is facing fresh questions over its bailout of an embattled coal mine that is critical to the state's energy system, amid revelations taxpayer money is leaking offshore.
